summary: Email correspondence between law enforcement officials regarding travel records for Ghislaine Maxwell, Jeffrey Epstein, and an unnamed individual. The email discusses requests for travel records from the UK and CBP records from the 1990s.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as a subject for whom travel records are being sought from the UK and CBP records from the 1990s.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as a subject for whom travel records are being sought from the UK and CBP records from the 1990s.

connections.description: Both are subjects of the same investigation for travel records, indicating they are being investigated together.

events.title: Request for travel records update
events.description: An email was sent inquiring about updates on travel records from the UK for Maxwell, Epstein, and an unnamed individual, and confirming if CBP records from the 1990s were requested.

events.title: Response regarding travel records
events.description: A response email indicates that FDR (presumably Flight Data Recorder or similar travel data) was sent to the UK and results are pending, and confirms records for an unnamed individual are attached.

keyFacts: Law enforcement was actively seeking travel records from the UK for Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein as of April 2021.
The investigation included requests for CBP (Customs and Border Protection) records from the 1990s for Maxwell and Epstein.
The email correspondence involves multiple agencies including the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, FBI, and NYPD.
An unnamed individual (redacted) is also a subject of the travel records request alongside Maxwell and Epstein.
